19:17.concept: Do not hate fellow covenant members

19:16.concept: Do not stand idly by if someone's life is in danger

19:32.concept: Honor the wise and the aged (who know and teach G-d's Law)

19:4.concept: Do not make an idol for others

19:31.concept: Do not consult magicians or seers

18:21.concept: Do not pass your children through the fire to Molech

26:1.concept: Do not bow down on smooth stone
26:1.category: 1 Οὐ ποιήσετε ὑμῖν αὐτοῖς χειροποίητα οὐδὲ γλυπτὰ οὐδὲ στήλην ἀναστήσετε ὑμῖν οὐδὲ λίθον σκοπὸν θήσετε ἐν τῇ γῇ ὑμῶν προσκυνῆσαι αὐτῷ· ἐγώ εἰμι κύριος ὁ θεὸς ὑμῶν.

20:23.concept: Do not imitate idolaters in customs and clothing
20:23.category: οὓς ἐξαποστέλλω ἀφ᾿ ὑμῶν· ὅτι ταῦτα πάντα ἐποίησαν

19:27.concept: Men must not shave the hair off the sides of their head
Men must not shave their beards with a razor

12:3.concept: Circumcise all males on the eighth day after their birth

23:32.concept: Do not do prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement
Rest from prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement

16:29.concept: Afflict yourself on the Day of Atonement

23:29.concept: Do not eat or drink on the Day of Atonement

23:7.concept: Rest on the first day of Passover
Do not do prohibited labor on the first day of Passover

23:8.concept: Rest on the seventh day of Passover
Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day of Passover

23:21.concept: Rest on the Feast of Weeks
Do not do prohibited labor on the Feast of Weeks

23:24.concept: Rest on the Feast of Trumpets

23:25.concept: Do not do prohibited labor on the Feast of Trumpets

23:35.concept: Rest on the Feast of Tabernacles
Do not do prohibited labor on the first day of the Feast of Tabernacles

23:36.concept: Rest on the eighth day of the Feast of Tabernacles
Do not do prohibited labor on the last day of the Feast of Tabernacles

23:42.concept: Dwell in a temporary shelter for the seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles
23:42.category: πᾶς ὁ αὐτόχθων ἐν Ισραηλ κατοικήσει ἐν σκηναῖς

23:40.concept: Take up a Lulav and Etrog all seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles
23:40.category: 40 καὶ λήμψεσθε τῇ ἡμέρᾳ τῇ πρώτῃ καρπὸν ξύλου ὡραῖον καὶ κάλλυνθρα φοινίκων καὶ κλάδους ξύλου δασεῖς καὶ ἰτέας καὶ ἄγνου κλάδους ἐκ χειμάρρου εὐφρανθῆναι ἔναντι κυρίου τοῦ θεοῦ ὑμῶν ἑπτὰ ἡμέρας

18:7.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your mother
Do not have homosexual sexual relations with your father

18:8.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your father's wife

18:9.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your sister

18:11.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your father's wife's daughter

18:10.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your son's daughter
Do not have sexual relations with your daughter's daughter

18:6.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your daughter
Do not make pleasurable (sexual) contact with any forbidden woman

18:17.concept: Do not have sexual relations with a woman and her daughter
Do not have sexual relations with a woman and her son's daughter
Do not have sexual relations with a woman and her daughter's daughter

18:12.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your father's sister

18:13.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your mother's sister

18:14.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your father's brother's wife
Do not have homosexual sexual relations with your father's brother

18:15.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your son's wife

18:16.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your brother's wife

18:18.concept: Do not have sexual relations with your wife's sister

18:23.concept: A man must not have sexual relations with an animal
A woman must not have sexual relations with an animal

18:22.concept: Do not have homosexual sexual relations

18:20.concept: Do not have sexual relations with someone else's wife

18:19.concept: Do not have sexual relations with a menstrually impure woman

22:24.concept: Do not offer to G-d any castrated male animals
22:24.category: οὐ προσάξεις αὐτὰ τῷ κυρίῳ καὶ ἐπὶ τῆς γῆς ὑμῶν οὐ ποιήσετε.

22:24.concept: Do not sprinkle a blemished animal's blood

21:14.concept: The high priest must not marry a widow
21:14.category: 14 χήραν δὲ καὶ ἐκβεβλημένην καὶ βεβηλωμένην καὶ πόρνην

21:15.concept: The high priest must not have sexual relations with a widow even outside of marriage

21:13.concept: The high priest must marry a virgin maiden

21:7.concept: A priest must not marry a divorcee
A priest must not marry a woman who has had a forbidden sexual relationship
A priest must not marry a desecrated woman

11:2.concept: Examine the signs of animals to distinguish between those which are kosher and non-kosher

11:9.concept: Examine the signs of fish to distinguish between those which are kosher and non-kosher
11:9.category: אֲשֶׁר בַּמָּיִם: כֹּל אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ סְנַפִּיר וְקַשְׂקֶשֶׂת בַּמַּיִם

11:21.concept: Examine the signs of insects to distinguish between those which are kosher and non-kosher

11:41.concept: Do not eat non-kosher creatures that crawl on land

11:44.category: 44 ὅτι ἐγώ εἰμι κύριος ὁ θεὸς ὑμῶν

11:42.concept: Do not eat worms found in fruit on the ground

11:43.concept: Do not eat creatures that live in water other than kosher fish

3:17.concept: Do not eat certain fats of clean animals

23:14.concept: Do not eat bread from new grain before the Omer
23:14.category: ἕως ἂν προσενέγκητε ὑμεῖς τὰ δῶρα τῷ θεῷ ὑμῶν· νόμιμον αἰώνιον εἰς τὰς γενεὰς ὑμῶν ἐν πάσῃ κατοικίᾳ ὑμῶν.

23:14.concept: Do not eat parched grains from new grain before the Omer
Do not eat ripened grains from new grain before the Omer

19:23.concept: Do not eat fruit of a tree during its first three years
19:23.category: καὶ καταφυτεύσετε πᾶν ξύλον βρώσιμον καὶ περικαθαριεῖτε τὴν ἀκαθαρσίαν αὐτοῦ· ὁ καρπὸς αὐτοῦ τρία ἔτη ἔσται ὑμῖν ἀπερικάθαρτος

22:28.concept: Do not slaughter an animal and its offspring on the same day

17:13.concept: Cover the blood of a slaughtered beast or fowl with earth

19:12.concept: Do not swear falsely in G-d's Name

19:11.concept: Do not deny possession of something entrusted to you
Do not falsely swear in denial of a claim to property
Do not steal money by lying

27:2.concept: Estimate the value of people as determined by the Law

27:12.concept: Estimate the value of consecrated animals
27:12.category: καὶ καθότι ἂν τιμήσεται ὁ ἱερεύς

27:14.concept: Estimate the value of consecrated houses
27:14.category: ὃς ἂν ἁγιάσῃ τὴν οἰκίαν αὐτοῦ ἁγίαν τῷ κυρίῳ

27:16.concept: Estimate the value of consecrated fields
27:16.category: καὶ ἔσται ἡ τιμὴ κατὰ τὸν σπόρον αὐτοῦ

27:28.concept: Carry out the laws of interdicting possessions

19:19.concept: Do not plant diverse seeds together

19:10.concept: Leave a corner of the field uncut for the poor
Leave the gleanings of a vineyard for the poor
Do not gather the gleanings of a vineyard but leave them for the poor
Leave the unformed clusters of grapes for the poor
Do not pick the unformed clusters of grapes but leave them for the poor

19:9.concept: Do not reap the corner of a field left for the poor
Leave gleanings of a field for the poor
Do not gather gleanings of a crop but leave them for the poor

22:10.concept: A non- priest must not eat food set aside as a gift for the priest
A hired worker or an Israelite bondsman of a priest must not eat food set aside as a gift for the priest

22:4.concept: An impure priest must not eat food set aside for a priest

22:12.concept: A desecrated woman must not eat food set aside for a priest

19:24.concept: The fourth year crops must be totally for holy purposes like the second tithe

25:4.concept: Do not work the land during the seventh year
Do not work with trees to produce fruit during the seventh year
25:4.category: The Sabbatical Year and the Jubilee

25:5.concept: Do not reap crops that grow wild during the seventh year in the normal manner
Do not gather grapes which grow wild during the seventh year in the normal way
25:5.category: The Sabbatical Year and the Jubilee

25:8.concept: The Sanhedrin must count seven groups of seven years

25:10.concept: The Sanhedrin must sanctify the fiftieth year

25:9.concept: Blow the ram's horn on the tenth day of the seventh month to free the slaves
25:9.category: 9 καὶ διαγγελεῖτε σάλπιγγος φωνῇ ἐν πάσῃ τῇ γῇ ὑμῶν τῷ μηνὶ τῷ ἑβδόμῳ τῇ δεκάτῃ τοῦ μηνός· τῇ ἡμέρᾳ τοῦ ἱλασμοῦ διαγγελεῖτε σάλπιγγι ἐν πάσῃ τῇ γῇ ὑμῶν

25:11.concept: Do not work the soil during the fiftieth year
Do not reap in the normal manner that which grows wild in the fiftieth year
Do not pick grapes which grew wild in the normal manner in the fiftieth year

25:24.concept: Carry out the laws of sold family properties in the fiftieth year

25:23.concept: Do not sell the land in Israel indefinitely
25:23.category: 23 καὶ ἡ γῆ οὐ πραθήσεται εἰς βεβαίωσιν

25:29.concept: Carry out the laws of houses in walled cities

25:34.concept: Do not sell the fields of the Levites but they shall belong to Levites before and after the Jubilee year

10:9.concept: A priest must not enter the Temple intoxicated

10:6.concept: A priest must not enter the Temple with his head uncovered
A priest must not enter the Temple with torn clothes

16:2.concept: A priest must not enter the sanctuary of the Temple indiscriminately

10:7.concept: A priest must not leave the Temple during service

22:2.concept: Impure priests must not do service in the Temple

21:23.concept: A priest with a physical blemish must not enter the sanctuary or approach the altar

21:17.concept: A priest with a physical blemish must not serve
A priest with a temporary blemish must not serve

22:21.concept: Do not inflict wounds upon dedicated animals

22:20.concept: Do not dedicate a blemished animal for the altar

22:22.concept: Do not slaughter a blemished animal
Do not burn a blemished animal's fat

22:25.concept: Do not sacrifice blemished animals even if offered by those who are not part of the Covenant

22:27.concept: Offer only animals which are at least eight days old

2:11.concept: Do not burn honey or yeast on the altar

2:13.concept: Do not omit the salt from sacrifices

1:3.concept: Carry out the procedure of the burnt offering as prescribed in the Law

6:25.concept: Carry out the procedure of the sin offering

6:23.concept: Do not eat the meat of the inner sin offering

5:8.concept: Do not decapitate a fowl brought as a sin offering

7:1.concept: Carry out the procedure of the guilt offering

7:11.concept: Follow the procedure of the peace offering

2:1.concept: Bring meal offerings as prescribed in the Torah

5:11.concept: Do not put oil on the meal offerings of wrongdoers
Do not put frankincense on the meal offerings of wrongdoers

6:16.concept: Do not eat the meal offering of a priest
The priests must eat the remains of the meal offerings

6:17.concept: Do not bake a meal offering as leavened bread

17:3.concept: Do not slaughter sacrifices outside the Temple

6:9.concept: Keep the fire burning on the altar
Do not extinguish the fire on the altar

6:10.concept: Remove the ashes from the altar every day
6:10.category: ἣν ἂν καταναλώσῃ τὸ πῦρ τὴν ὁλοκαύτωσιν

6:20.concept: The high priest must bring a meal offering every day

23:10.concept: Offer the wave offering from the meal of the new wheat

23:15.concept: Each man must count seven weeks from the day the new wheat offering was brought after Passover

23:17.concept: Bring two loaves to accompany the additional the Feast of Weeks offerings
23:17.category: δύο ἄρτους· ἐκ δύο δεκάτων σεμιδάλεως ἔσονται

7:18.concept: Do not eat from sacrifices offered with improper intentions
7:18.category: 18 ἐὰν δὲ φαγὼν φάγῃ ἀπὸ τῶν κρεῶν τῇ ἡμέρᾳ τῇ τρίτῃ

22:30.concept: Do not leave sacrifices past the time allowed for eating them

19:8.concept: Do not eat from that which was left over from an offering

7:19.concept: Do not eat from sacrifices which became impure

7:20.concept: An impure person must not eat from sacrifices

16:3.concept: Follow the procedures of the Day of Atonement in the sequence prescribed

5:16.concept: One who profaned a sacred object must repay what he profaned plus a fifth and bring a sacrifice

27:32.category: τὸ δέκατον ἔσται ἅγιον τῷ κυρίῳ.

4:27.concept: Every person must bring a sin offering for his transgression

5:17.concept: Bring an asham offering when uncertain of guilt

6:6.concept: Bring an offering when guilt is determined for certain sins

5:7.concept: Bring an offering in accordance with one's financial ability

15:28.concept: A woman who had a running vaginal issue must bring an offering in the Temple after she immerses in water

12:6.concept: A woman who gave birth must bring an offering after she immerses in water

15:13.concept: A man who had a running unnatural urinary issue must bring an offering in the Temple after he immerses in water

14:10.concept: An leprous person must bring an offering after immersing in water

27:10.concept: Do not substitute another beast for one set apart for sacrifice
27:10.category: ἔσται αὐτὸ καὶ τὸ ἄλλαγμα ἅγια.

27:10.concept: Both an animal offered as a substitution as well as an animal set apart for sacrifice retain their consecration

27:26.concept: Do not change consecrated animals from one type of offering to another

13:12.concept: Follow the commandments of human leprosy as prescribed in the Law

13:33.concept: The leprous person must not shave signs of impurity in his hair

14:2.concept: Carry out the prescribed rules for purifying the leprous person

14:9.concept: The leprous person must shave off all his hair prior to purification

13:47.concept: Carry out the laws of leprous clothing

14:34.concept: Carry out the laws of leprous houses

15:19.concept: Observe the laws of menstrual impurity
15:19.category: ἔσται ἡ ῥύσις αὐτῆς ἐν τῷ σώματι αὐτῆς

12:2.concept: Observe the laws of impurity caused by childbirth

15:25.concept: Observe the laws of impurity caused by a woman's running issue

15:3.concept: Observe the laws of impurity caused by a man's running issue
15:3.category: ἧς συνέστηκεν τὸ σῶμα αὐτοῦ διὰ τῆς ῥύσεως

11:39.concept: Observe the laws of impurity caused by a dead beast

11:29.concept: Observe the laws of impurity caused by the eight listed creatures

15:16.concept: Observe the laws of impurity of a seminal emission
Every impure person must immerse himself in water to become pure

11:34.concept: Observe the laws of impurity concerning liquid and solid foods

19:36.concept: Each individual must ensure that his scales and weights are accurate
19:36.category: 36 ζυγὰ δίκαια καὶ στάθμια δίκαια καὶ χοῦς δίκαιος ἔσται ὑμῖν· ἐγώ εἰμι κύριος ὁ θεὸς ὑμῶν ὁ ἐξαγαγὼν ὑμᾶς ἐκ γῆς Αἰγύπτου.

19:35.concept: Do not commit injustice with scales and weights

19:13.concept: Do not withhold wages or fail to repay a debt
Do not delay payment of wages past the agreed time

6:5.concept: Return a stolen object or its value

19:14.concept: Do not put a stumbling block before a blind man
Do not curse any upstanding Israelite

25:14.concept: Buy and sell according to G-d's Law
Do not overcharge or underpay for an article

25:17.concept: Do not insult or harm anybody with words

25:42.concept: Do not sell a Hebrew as a non-Hebrew is sold

25:43.concept: Do not work a Hebrew slave oppressively

25:53.concept: Do not allow a non-Israelite to work a Hebrew slave oppressively

25:39.concept: Do not have a Hebrew slave do menial slave labor

25:46.concept: Canaanite slaves must work forever unless injured in one of their limbs
25:46.category: καὶ καταμεριεῖτε αὐτοὺς τοῖς τέκνοις ὑμῶν μεθ᾿ ὑμᾶς

20:14.concept: The courts must carry out the death penalty of burning
20:14.category: 14 ὃς ἐὰν λάβῃ γυναῖκα καὶ τὴν μητέρα αὐτῆς

20:10.concept: The courts must carry out the death penalty of strangulation

19:15.concept: A judge must not have mercy on the poor man at the trial
A judge must not respect the great man at the trial
19:15.category: The Sanhedrin and the Penalties Under Their Jurisdiction

19:15.concept: A judge must not pervert justice
19:15.category: The Sanhedrin and the Penalties Under Their Jurisdiction
The Sanhedrin and the Penalties Under Their Jurisdiction

5:1.concept: Anybody who knows evidence must testify in court

10:19.category: καὶ συμβέβηκέν μοι ταῦτα· καὶ φάγομαι τὰ περὶ τῆς ἁμαρτίας σήμερον

21:11.concept: The high priest must not defile himself for any relative
The high priest must not enter under the same roof as a corpse

21:1.concept: A priest must not defile himself (by going to funerals or cemeteries) for anyone except relatives
